nlp_patient:
Moderate diabetic retinal changes are present. There is evidence of vascular leakage and small hemorrhages.

Closer follow-up (3–6 months) is advised along with systemic risk review. Key systemic risk factors:

hypertension. Detected lesion highlights: exudates (2.50%), hemorrhages (5.00%). Reported model accuracy:

0.93. Arrange ophthalmology follow-up in 3–6 months; consider OCT if macular edema suspected.

Moderate NPDR: multiple dot-blot hemorrhages and leak indications. Recommend 3–6 month surveillance and OCT if

macular edema suspected. Lesion metrics: exudates=2.5, hemorrhages=5.0 The heatmap does not show a

concentrated activation; evidence is distributed. Recommended actions: Arrange ophthalmology follow-up in 3–6

months; consider OCT if macular edema suspected.
